hiringOrganization.name: California Institute Of Technology Jet Propulsion Laboratory

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Do you love problem solving, analyzing data and technical challenges? Do you enjoy interacting with business partners and domain experts to understand their business problems and needs, then conveying the passion and expertise to transform these problems or needs from requirements to find technical solutions that deliver value? How about guiding and mentoring others for continuous improvement in what we do and how we do it? If this sounds like you to these, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

Enterprise Business Information Services (EBIS) seeks a senior Enterprise Systems Analyst to join our team. In this highly impactful, far-reaching role, you can demonstrate highly collaborative behavior, be results-oriented, and exhibit domain expertise experiences in both technology and business insight. The ideal candidate works independently and in collaboration with other team members, is analytical, applies good judgment, and has multi-tasking skills to support the business systems needs of both internal and external customers, including the timely accomplishment of performance, delivery, and schedule landmarks. In addition, the candidate should have and will demonstrate extensive knowledge and experience in systems analysis techniques, guide and mentor others in these techniques, and engage in a leadership role for enhancing our business analysis techniques and processes.

The EBIS Division maintains stewardship over the ever-evolving Business IT portfolio of applications and systems required to support JPL's robust and complex business processes. EBIS manages the full system lifecycle across all major business processes, provides analytical and technical services, and strategically partners with the Laboratory's business community to ensure continuous delivery of business IT services.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 9 years of related experience or Master’s degree with 7 years of related experience in Information Management System, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, Finance, or related disciplines.
  • Extensive understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in Project Management, Data Management, Requirements Gathering, User Acceptance, Software Quality Assurance, Software Implementation, and User/Customer Support. This understanding results in contributions to the development of new theories and methods.
  • Wide-ranging experience must include effectively collaborate effective collaboration with users providing training and technical support.
  • Effective experience leading dynamic teams composed of product leads, project managers, system engineers, solution architects, developers, and operations.
  • Have advanced knowledge of business and IT processes including waterfall and agile/scrum methodologies.
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, and must be capable of effectively gathering and transferring technical and functional information. Must have the ability to develop and conduct product demos, user workshops, joint design sessions, training, and user acceptance sessions.
  • Excellent leadership skills, capable of leading, directing and training, software developers, system administrators, system engineers, software quality assurance, other enterprise system analyst, functional users and management.

Job Requirements:

  • Work with users to gain understanding of business processes
  • Guide users through the process of providing meaningful requirements and help them achieve their real business needs
  • Participates in analysis of business requirements, multi-functional information dependencies and systems impacts
  • Coordinate system enhancements and software solutions/products roll-out
  • Work closely with development staff to define and implement software solutions
  • Develop test plans, use cases and user stories
  • Lead System Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing efforts
  • Keep our products current and relevant by proposing improvements as business needs change, or as new features become available
  • Good interpersonal skills, integrity and self-awareness, to communicate comfortably with all levels of staff and management

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks

The hiring range displayed below is specifically for those who will work in or reside in the location listed. In extending an offer, Jet Propulsion Laboratory considers factors including, but not limited to, the candidate’s job related skills, experience, knowledge, and relevant education/training. Hiring range for this job may be adjusted based on primary work location outside of Pasadena, California. This adjusted range will be provided to candidates by the Recruiter when applicable.

The typical full time equivalent annual hiring range for this job in Pasadena, California.

$128,648 - $164,008

JPL is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy or perceived pregnancy, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status or any other characteristic or condition protected by Federal, state or local law.

In addition, JPL is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

EEO is the Law.

EEO is the Law Supplement

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory is a federal facility. Due to rules imposed by NASA, JPL will not accept applications from citizens of designated countries or those born in a designated country unless they are Legal Permanent Residents of the U.S or have other protected status under 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). The Designated Countries List is available here.
jobPostingInfo.title: Senior Enterprise Systems Analyst - IT
